data.title: Currency Converter
data.statement:
It is 3 November 2023 5:06 AM UTC. Imagine your friend is an international traveller. This time, he travels to India. He exchanges foreign currency for INR. Convert the given currency into Indian Rupees and determine whether he has the correct exchange amount.

You must always output your own conversion in form of a float. There is no such test case where you would get an absurd amount of decimal places so rounding as such is not required, <<but if the number appears to be an integer you must add one decimal place (one zero) at the end>> (for example 500 becomes 500.0)

Approx. conversion rates at that time:
1 USD = 83.25 INR
1 CNY = 11.38 INR
1 EUR = 88.48 INR

testCases.title: Test 1
testCases.testOut: Following the conversion rate of 1 CNY = 11.38 INR, the exchange amount is ok :)

testCases.title: Validator 1
testCases.testOut: Following the conversion rate of 1 USD = 83.25 INR, the exchange amount is ok :)

testCases.title: Test 2
testCases.testOut: Following the conversion rate of 1 EUR = 88.48 INR, the exchange amount is less by 4374.0 INR :(

testCases.title: Validator 2
testCases.testOut: Following the conversion rate of 1 EUR = 88.48 INR, the exchange amount is less by 983.76 INR :(

testCases.title: Test 3
testCases.testOut: Following the conversion rate of 1 CNY = 11.38 INR, the exchange amount is more by 1263.44 INR.

testCases.title: Validator 3
testCases.testOut: Following the conversion rate of 1 USD = 83.25 INR, the exchange amount is more by 1394.4375 INR.

data.constraints:
0 < [[foreign_currency_amount]] < 999999
0 < [[indian_currency_amount]] < 999999
0 < Input line length < 999

[[indian_currency_amount]] and [[foreign_currency_amount]] may be integers or floats, they should ideally be treated as floats.
data.outputDescription:
<<IF THE INPUT IS VALID:>>

<<Line 1:>> {{Following the conversion rate of 1}} [[foreign_currency_name]] {{=}} [[currency exchange rate]] {{INR, the exchange amount is}} [[message]]

[[currency exchange rate]]s are given in the "Goal" section.

Where [[message]] is one of the following based on the accuracy of exchange amount:
- {{ok :)}}
- {{less by [[XXX]] INR :(}}
- {{more by [[XXX]] INR}}
(Where [[XXX]] is the amount by which it is less/more)

<<IF THE INPUT IS INVALID:>>
<<Line 1:>> {{Invalid input.}}

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

It is 3 November 2023 5:06 AM UTC. Imagine your friend is an international traveller. This time, he travels to India. He exchanges foreign currency for INR. Convert the given currency into Indian Rupees and determine whether he has the correct exchange amount.

You must always output your own conversion in form of a float. There is no such test case where you would get an absurd amount of decimal places so rounding as such is not required, but if the number appears to be an integer you must add one decimal place (one zero) at the end (for example 500 becomes 500.0)

Approx. conversion rates at that time:
1 USD = 83.25 INR
1 CNY = 11.38 INR
1 EUR = 88.48 INR
Input
Line 1: indian_currency_amount INR for foreign_currency_amount foreign_currency_name
Output
IF THE INPUT IS VALID:

Line 1: Following the conversion rate of 1 foreign_currency_name = currency exchange rate INR, the exchange amount is message

currency exchange rates are given in the "Goal" section.

Where message is one of the following based on the accuracy of exchange amount:
- ok :)
- less by XXX INR :(
- more by XXX INR
(Where XXX is the amount by which it is less/more)

IF THE INPUT IS INVALID:
Line 1: Invalid input.
Constraints
0 < foreign_currency_amount < 999999
0 < indian_currency_amount < 999999
0 < Input line length < 999

indian_currency_amount and foreign_currency_amount may be integers or floats, they should ideally be treated as floats.
Example
Input
569 INR for 50 CNY
Output
Following the conversion rate of 1 CNY = 11.38 INR, the exchange amount is ok :)
